subject: Re: ANT and JUNIT Integration Problem
msgSnippet: ... to ... runs the ... and ... Ant ... J.B, The ANT file is shown below. There is a lot of stuff in it, but I would pay attention to the instrument and
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...>
wrote:
> Jason Rogers wrote:
>
> > On Mon, 25 Aug 2003 21:15:04 -0000, "seanevans52173"
> > <sean.evans521@c...> said:
> > > I am using Ant to compile and test Java code with Junit.
> > >
> > > Each time I make a change to the Junit test code then use Ant
to
> > > recompile and run the test it compiles the test code, but it
runs the
> > > previously compiled version of the test code.
> > >
> > > Therefore, I have to run Ant twice to get the results I want.
> > >
> > > Note: This happens when there is an existing compiled test code
> > > already there when you run Ant. In other words, if I run Ant
and
> > > there is no existing compiled test code class (like if I run
Ant
> > > clean first) it will work fine.
> > >
> > > Have you seen this before?
> >
>
> Your output paths are wrong. I can't say more than that without a
> buildfile, but I'm dead sure of it.
> --
> J. B. Rainsberger,
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
> Let's write software that people understand

J.B,

The ANT file is shown below. There is a lot of stuff in it, but I
would pay attention to the "instrument" and "test" targets. It may be
easier viewed if you copy and paste into an editor.


<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<!-- build.xml -->

<!-- Ant build file for the General Utilities BusinessWorks XPath
Functions. -->

<!-- $Id: build.xml,v 1.2 2003/08/19 19:49:09 hcdarda Exp $ -->

<!-- Copyright (c) 2001-2003 by -->
<!-- Aspen Technologies, Inc. Cambridge, MA -->
<!-- All rights reserved. -->

<!-- AspenTech disclaims all warranties with regard to this
software, -->
<!-- including all implied warranties of merchantability and
fitness. -->
<!-- In no event shall AspenTech be liable for any special,
indirect -->
<!-- or consequential damages or any damages whatsoever resulting -->
<!-- from loss of use, data or profits, whether in an action of -->
<!-- contract, negligence or other tortuous action, arising out of
or -->
<!-- in connection with the use or performance of this software. -->

<!-- This software is provided on an "as is" basis, and the authors --
>
<!-- and distributors have no obligation to provide maintenance, -->
<!-- support, updates, enhancements, or modifications. -->

<!-- Copying or other reproduction of this program except for -->
<!-- archival purposes is prohibited without the prior written -->
<!-- consent of Aspen Technologies, Inc ( AspenTech ). -->

<!-- RESTRICTED RIGHTS LEGEND -->

<!-- Use, duplication, or disclosure by the U.S. Government is -->
<!-- subject to restrictions as set forth in subdivision (b) (3)
(ii) -->
<!-- of the Rights in Technical Data and Computer Software clause at -
->
<!-- 52.227-7013. -->

<!-- Type 'ant' to build or 'ant -projecthelp' for a list of
commands. -->
<!-- See http://ant.apache.org -->

<project name="General Utilities" default="dist" basedir=".">
<description>
Copyright (c) 2001-2003 by
Aspen Technologies, Inc. Cambridge, MA
All rights reserved.
</description>

<!-- Set up global properties -->

<!-- When building ALL of EnterpriseConnect, this property will be
set to the location -->
<!-- where all build artifacts will be kept. Developer's should not
reset this property -->
<property name="build.ec.location" value="."/>

<!-- All build artifacts for all components are placed under this
directory. -->
<property name="build.dir" value="${build.ec.location}/build"/>

<!-- The source code for this component can be found in this
directory -->
<property name="src.dir" value="${basedir}/GeneralUtilities"/>

<!-- The directory resembling the package name. This is needed
because when the -->
<!-- jcoverage reports are generated, it is expected that the JAVA
code is actually -->
<!-- in the ${src.dir}/<package name> directory. -->
<property name="src.temp.dir"
value="${src.dir}/com/aspentech/aep/ec/utils"/>

<!-- The build artifacts for this particular utility are placed
under this directory. -->
<property name="build.specific.dir"
value="${build.dir}/GeneralUtilities/bw"/>

<!-- The classes generated by the javac compiler are placed in this
directory. -->
<property name="build.classes.dir"
value="${build.specific.dir}/classes"/>

<!-- The instrumented classes are placed in this directory. -->
<property name="build.instrumented.dir"
value="${build.specific.dir}/instrumented-classes"/>

<!-- Coverage reports are placed in this directory. For the HTML
report, -->
<!-- look at ${build.coverage.dir}/index.html. For the XML report,
look -->
<!-- at ${build.coverage.dir}/coverage.xml. -->
<property name="build.coverage.dir"
value="${build.specific.dir}/coverage"/>

<!-- Unit test reports from junit are placed in this directory. The
type and location of -->
<!-- the report depends on the setting of the ${junit.format.type)
property: -->
<!-- brief: only prints detailed information for test cases
that failed (THE DEFAULT) -->
<!-- plain: prints a little statistics line for each test case -
->
<!-- xml: prints an XML file, which can then be used
by 'junitreport' -->
<!-- The text report is placed under the
${build.specific.dir}/reports/text directory. -->
<!-- The html report is placed under the
${build.specific.dir}/reports/html directory. -->
<property name="build.reports.dir"
value="${build.specific.dir}/reports"/>

<!-- The format type of the report generated for the JUNIT tests.
To override this format -->
<!-- reset during build process. -->
<property name="junit.format.type" value="brief"/>

<!-- This variable is used to determine whether or not
the 'junitreport' target should be -->
<!-- executed. If the ${junit.format.type} property was set
to 'xml' the target will be -->
<!-- executed; otherwise, it will not. -->
<property name="${junit.format.type}" value=""/>

<!-- Java docs for the application classes are placed in this
directory. -->
<property name="build.jdocs.dir"
value="${build.specific.dir}/jdocs"/>

<!-- The resulting JAR file created for this component. -->
<property name="utilsgeneralutilities.jar"
value="${build.specific.dir}/utilsGeneralUtilities.jar"/>

<!-- This is needed to compile the code, since it uses logging. -->
<property name="tibco.dir" location="c:/tibco"/>
<property name="log4j.jar"
location="${tibco.dir}/tra/1.0/lib/ext/log4j.jar"/>
<!-- Define variable for debugging task, and set to 'true' by
default. -->
<property name="debug" value="true"/>

<!-- Make available the ANT tasks for jcoverage -->
<property environment="env"/>
<path id="jcoverage">
<fileset dir="${env.ANT_HOME}/lib/jcoverage-1.0.5">
<include name="jcoverage.jar"/>
</fileset>
</path>
<taskdef classpathref="jcoverage" resource="tasks.properties"/>

<!-- This is the distribution target. Running 'ant' with no target
name specified -->
<!-- will execute this target by default. -->
<target name="dist"
depends="package,junithtmlreport,junittxtreport,coveragereport"/>

<!-- This target handles the removal of all built artifacts. It
removes the entire -->
<!-- build directory, and removes the jcoverage.ser and
jcoverage.log files. -->
<target name="clean" description="Clean up the build artifacts
specific to this component.">
<delete failonerror="false" includeEmptyDirs="true">
<fileset dir="${build.dir}"/>
<fileset dir="${src.dir}/com"/>
<fileset dir="${basedir}">
<include name="jcoverage.ser"/>
<include name="jcoverage.log"/>
</fileset>
</delete>
</target>

<!-- This is the first target called. Its responsibility is to
create the -->
<!-- necessary build directories. -->
<target name="init" description="Create build directories specific
to this component.">
<mkdir dir="${build.dir}"/>
<mkdir dir="${build.classes.dir}"/>
<mkdir dir="${build.coverage.dir}"/>
<mkdir dir="${build.instrumented.dir}"/>
<mkdir dir="${build.jdocs.dir}"/>
<mkdir dir="${build.reports.dir}"/>
<mkdir dir="${build.specific.dir}"/>

<mkdir dir="${src.temp.dir}"/>
</target>

<!-- Compile the source code for this component. -->
<target name="compile" depends="init" description="Compile all
classes.">
<javac
debug="${debug}"
srcdir="${src.dir}"
destdir="${build.classes.dir}"
classpath="${log4j.jar}"
excludes="**/com/aspentech/aep/ec/utils/*.java"
failonerror="yes"/>
</target>

<!-- Create package for compiled source -->
<target name="package" depends="compile" description="Package the
application classes.">
<jar jarfile="${utilsgeneralutilities.jar}">
<manifest>
<attribute name="Built-By" value="${user.name}"/>
<attribute name="Implementation-Title"
value="utilsGeneralUtilities.jar"/>
<attribute name="Implementation-Vendor" value="Aspen
Technology, Inc."/>
</manifest>
<fileset dir="${build.classes.dir}">
<exclude name="**/*Test.class"/>
</fileset>
</jar>
</target>

<!-- Instrument the compiled classes, in preparation for performing
coverage analysis -->
<target name="instrument" depends="compile" description="Add
jcoverage instrumentation.">
<!-- Instrument the application classes, writing the
instrumented -->
<!-- classes to ${build.instrumented.dir}. -->
<instrument todir="${build.instrumented.dir}">

<!-- Note that the following line causes instrument to ignore
any -->
<!-- source line containing a reference to log4j, for the
purposes -->
<!-- of coverage reporting. -->
<ignore regex="org.apache.log4j.*"/>

<fileset dir="${build.classes.dir}">
<!-- Instrument all the application classes, but don't
instrument -->
<!-- the test classes. -->
<include name="**/*.class"/>
<exclude name="**/*Test.class"/>
</fileset>
</instrument>
</target>

<!-- Execute the set of unit tests for this component -->
<target name="test" depends="instrument" description="Unit test the
application.">
<junit fork="yes" dir="${basedir}" printsummary="yes"
errorProperty="test.failed" failureProperty="test.failed">

<!-- Note the classpath order, instrumented classes are before
the -->
<!-- original (uninstrumented) classes. -->
<classpath location="${build.instrumented.dir}"/>
<classpath location="${build.classes.dir}"/>

<!-- The instrumented classes reference classes used by the -->
<!-- jcoverage runtime. -->
<classpath refid="jcoverage"/>

<formatter type="${junit.format.type}"/>

<test name="${testcase}" todir="${build.reports.dir}"
if="testcase"/>

<batchtest todir="${build.reports.dir}" unless="testcase">
<fileset dir="${src.dir}">
<include name="**/*Test.java"/>
</fileset>
</batchtest>
</junit>
</target>

<!-- Generate HTML report from JUNIT test results, if configured. --
>
<target name="junithtmlreport" depends="test" description="Generate
JUNIT HTML report." if="xml">
<junitreport todir="${build.reports.dir}">
<fileset dir="${build.reports.dir}">
<include name="TEST-*.xml"/>
</fileset>
<report format="frames" todir="${build.reports.dir}/html"/>
</junitreport>
<echo>
junit report has been generated.
The HTML report is ${build.reports.dir}/html/index.html
</echo>
</target>

<!-- Generate TEXT report from JUNIT test results, if configured. --
>
<target name="junittxtreport" depends="test" description="Generate
JUNIT TEXT report." unless="xml">
<echo>
junit report has been generated.
The TEXT report is ${build.reports.dir}/TEST-classname.txt
</echo>
</target>

<!-- Generate coverage reports from the results of JUNIT test
execution. -->
<target name="coveragereport" depends="test" description="HTML and
XML coverage reports can be found in build/coverage">
<copy todir="${src.temp.dir}">
<fileset dir="${src.dir}">
<include name="GeneralUtilities.java"/>
</fileset>
</copy>

<report srcdir="${src.dir}" destdir="${build.coverage.dir}"/>
<report srcdir="${src.dir}" destdir="${build.coverage.dir}"
format="xml"/>

<echo>
jcoverage reports have been generated.
The HTML report is ${build.coverage.dir}/index.html
The XML report is ${build.coverage.dir}/coverage.xml
</echo>
</target>

<!-- Generate Java documentation for source. -->
<target name="jdocs" depends="init">
<javadoc
destdir="${build.jdocs.dir}"
author="true"
version="true"
use="true"
windowtitle="General Utilities BusinessWorks XPath Functions">
<fileset dir="${src.dir}" excludes="**/*Test.java,
**/com/aspentech/aep/ec/utils/*.java"/>
</javadoc>
</target>


</project>
